queries: Some signers also position the subordinate hand as if holding onto reins.
verbLexeme: 1. To hit an animal, especially a horse, with a piece of leather or rope fastened to a handle to make it work harder or run faster. English = whip.
nominalLexeme: 1. A person who rides horses in a race. English = jockey.
oldEntry: Popular explanation: hitting a horse with a whip.
